title: Feet on the Streets against all things trump

location.venue: Corner of Jack in the box and Panera

description:
Are you tired of sitting home and feeling helpless about the current regime?

Big crowds aren't your thing?

We have an alternative to the bigger protests on a weekly basis.  

Our little group is growing - come join us! Everyone is welcome!

This is becoming a regular spot for our voices to be heard and for the unengaged to see "regular people" fighting for democracy consistently.  

We are getting lots of positive beeps and encouragement from the community, especially the foot traffic - they have been very welcoming!

Just being with like-minded people is helpful and it's inspiring.   It's absolutely the antidote to our fear and frustration -- we instead turn it into action!

Doing something feels AMAZING!  

I promise you -- it all matters and it all works!

Let's get in some Good Trouble together, before they take away that right!

Bring a sign and come on down - we always have an extra sign or two, so don't let that stop you from joining us !

Be a PART of the fight with us!

Meantime, take heart ... "tomorrow, there will be more of us ..."

**Ask about our other local events on different dates and different corners (a midweek Juan Vargas office protest every Wednesday from 12 to 1pm - or just search Chula Vista right here for other links!)**

Beeeeeeep Beeeeeeeeeep!!!

See you on the streets!

description:
Join us as we celebrate and support the voices of Veterans!

America made a promise to its veterans. It's a promise we intend to keep.

On June 6th, join thousands of veterans, military families, and their allies on the National Mall in Washington, D.C., for the Unite for Veterans, Unite for America Rally.

We are coming together to defend the benefits, jobs, and dignity that every generation of veterans has earned through sacrifice.

Veteran jobs, healthcare, and essential VA services are under attack. We will not stand by.

Veterans and military family members are being fired by the thousands from federal jobs. Our healthcare is being gutted. Our benefits are under siege.

This isn't the first time veterans have had to fight for what was promised. From the Bonus Army of 1932 to the battles for the GI Bill and Agent Orange care, veterans have always led the charge for justice.

Now, it's our turn.

We rally to:

Defend veteran and military family member employment in the federal workforce

Stop the privatization and weakening of the Department of Veterans Affairs

Hold political leaders accountable for policies that harm veterans and their families

title: New Tampa Dems - Partisan Voter Registration and Postcarding

address_lines: This eventâ€™s address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This eventâ€™s address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
Come join us at the New Tampa Regional Library for PARTISAN voter registration (via text message) and postcarding, in coordination with Field Team 6. 

We are ONLY registering Democrats and left-leaning independents/NPA. We'll show you how this is done when you come to the event.

Field Team 6 is the national leader in partisan voter registration, using a first-of-its-kind database to reach out via email, text, and postcard to register Democrats in the most flippable states and districts nationwide, where Democrats are needed most. 

We'll provide training on how to conduct the voter registration efforts via text (bring your own phone) and postcarding. If you've used the virtual phone bank (VPB) before, you will be using the same interface. An ActionID will be required (we can show you how to get this), and a Google Voice number is recommended (but not required).

title: 100% Clean Electricity Lobby Day

sponsor.name: New Jersey League of Conservation Voters

description:
Governor Murphy has committed to a 100% clean electricity future by 2035 through executive order. But unless this goal is passed by legislation, it could be delayed or eliminated entirely. 

Because the federal administration is moving full speed towards a grid powered by dirty energy, it is up to states to take action on climate change while we still can. And for this bill, we are running out of time. 

Join us at 9am on June 12th at the front steps of the Trenton State House Annex Building front steps to urge our leaders to pass this crucial legislation. If you want a cleaner and cheaper energy future for New Jersey that is free of dirty fossil fuels, we need your voice! Following this rally and media moment, join us for a day of action lobbying your own legislators - now is the time to make your voice heard. 

Sign up for more details.

title: NO KINGS Chelsea, MI
description:
No Kings Day of Action:
Protest & Picnic
Fighting Tyranny Through Community, Joy, and Action

June 14, 11-2pm
Pierce Park, Chelsea, MI

On June 14 - Flag Day - Donald Trump wants tanks in the street and a made-for-TV display of dominance for his birthday. A spectacle meant to look like strength. But real power isnâ€™t staged in Washington, it rises up everywhere in we the people.  No Kings is a nationwide day of defiance. From city blocks to small towns, from courthouse steps to community parks, we are taking action to reject authoritarianism - and show the world what democracy looks like.

Join us for a joyful community gathering where we rise together to fight tyranny with collective strength, celebration, and courage.

Hear from local nonprofits and progressive organizations about how to take action right here, right now.  Explore info tables to get involved with ongoing efforts and build real change in our community.

Then stay for an afternoon of resistance and renewal: a peaceful protest, live music, snacks, and creative activities.  Bring a picnic blanket, your family, your friends, your voice, and your joy.

Because community is our shield. resistance is our weapon. The flag doesnâ€™t belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to us. Letâ€™s take up space, take care of each other, and take action - together.

Hosted by Chelsea Grassroots * One World One Family * Dexter strong, Dexter cares.

Check out nokings.org for more information.

title: Glen Cove, NY: Tell Assemblymember Lavine: Pass NY HEAT!
description:
Join us for a rally outside Assemblymember Chuck Lavine's office to urge him to fight for clean and affordable energy by co-sponsoring and helping pass the NY HEAT Act.

**With the state budget finally done, Albany lawmakers must prioritize passing the NY HEAT Act in the waning weeks of the legislative session.**

New Yorkers are being crushed by unaffordable utility bills, and the NY HEAT Act is the solution we need â€” but Assembly Speaker Carl Heastie and legislative leadership are dragging their feet to put it to a vote.

The Senate has passed NY HEAT two years in a row. The Assembly must stop siding with fossil fuel interests and get it done this year!

The NY HEAT Act is our top climate priority, with its promise of lower energy bills while eliminating massive subsidies to the fracked gas industry.

As New Yorkers face the threats of climate change and rising costs of living, the NY HEAT Act will make energy more affordable while moving off fossil fuels.

_Rally co-sponsors: All Our Energy, Food & Water Watch, Long Island Progressive Coalition, Renewable Heat Now, Green Party of Nassau County (list in formation)_

title: Jefferson County Public School Strong Meeting
description:
Join us for the monthly meeting of the KFTC Jefferson County Public School Strong team. 

The Public School Strong Kentucky team are made up of parents, students, educators and community members who are committed to honest, equitable and fully funded public schools. We organize by school district, we support each other in turning out to local school board meetings to observe, make our Public School Strong movement visible, and speak up to promote, protect and strengthen our public education system. Anyone in Jefferson County who is committed to those principles can join the Jefferson County Public School Strong team in Kentucky.

We will gather in-person at the Jefferson County KFTC office.

To get a Public School Strong t-shirt, join the next virtual Public School Strong Orientation. Sign up at https://bit.ly/psstraining

title: Ukraine - Past, Present, and Future
description:
Please join us as we discuss past, current, and likely future events in Ukraine, and ways we may be able to help them through the current crisis.

We have many Ukrainian neighbors, with relatives who still experience the horror of the current war. I feel an obligation to learn all I can and how best I can help.Â  I hope you do,Â too! State Representative Eric Ager, a former diplomat, will be our guest speaker. Eric has served as a Democratic member of the North Carolina House of Representatives from the 114th district since 2023. He is well acquainted with the political turmoil in that region. 
We hope to also have attendance from AVL4Ukraine, a local support group.

Who should attend:  Everyone concerned about the war in Ukraine are invited to attend.

title: Double Down for Democracy: Modernize Voter Registration, Don't Restrict It
description:
Join us for a Day of Action at the Texas Capitol: Double Down for Democracy â€” Modernize Voter Registration, Donâ€™t Restrict It!

For the first time in over a decade, the House Elections Committee is holding a public hearing on online voter registration on Thursday, 5/15 at 8AM. This is a rare and important opportunity to show that Texans overwhelmingly support this commonsense, popular policy by registering your support for the bill (dropping a card).

While weâ€™re excited to highlight OVR, we want to be clear: HB 311 has no path forward this session, as the hearing is happening after a key legislative deadline.

At the same time, a real threat looms â€” new proof of citizenship requirements that could severely restrict voter registration access are making their way through the Legislature.

Thatâ€™s why we're not backing down, weâ€™re doubling down for democracy. On Thursday, weâ€™ll show support for HB 311 at the hearing by dropping cards and then visit legislative offices to urge lawmakers to oppose anti-voter bills like SB 16.

More details will be shared upon RSVPing! 

If you can't make it in person, you can submit online public comments here: https://www.mobilize.us/movetexas/event/788642/

description:

title: Book Talk with Dennis Crawford & Dr. Laura Crawford
description:
Join the Lancaster Democrats for a book talk on "Robert F. Kennedy: The Road Not Taken" with authors Dennis Crawford & Dr. Laura Crawford. Coffee and cookies will be provided and copies of the book will be available for purchase. Join us to learn about Robert F. Kennedy's campaign for President right here in Nebraska! 

About the book:

The Nebraska Democratic primary mattered in 1968. Because only fifteen states held primaries, Robert F. Kennedy and Eugene McCarthy made the state a high priority.

Before the reforms of the 1970s, most delegates to the national convention were selected in conventions and caucuses in which party leaders controlled the outcome. The candidates campaigned extensively in Nebraska to prove to the party bosses that they could carry farm states in the general election.

The Kennedy and McCarthy campaigns began to organize in Nebraska in early 1968. Both candidates campaigned hard in Nebraska. McCarthy literally worked himself into a state of exhaustion.

Nebraska brought out the best in Kennedy, and he brought out the best in Nebraska voters. He gave a hydrocephalic baby love at the Beatrice State Home and scolded draft-dodging students at Creighton University. Kennedy was genuinely concerned about the future of a school-age Black girl he met in north Omaha.

Kennedy defeated McCarthy by a decisive 52 percent to 31 percent margin. This big win put Kennedy on the path to the Democratic nomination and the White House.

About the Authors:

Dennis P. Crawford was the Democratic nominee for the U.S. House of Representative in 2014. A lifelong resident of Lincoln, Nebraska, Dennis earned his undergraduate degree in political science at Creighton University in 1982 and his law degree at the Catholic University of America in 1985. He returned to his hometown after he graduated from law school and practiced law in the Nebraska courts between 1986â€“2023. Dennis was a trial lawyer who represented people who were injured in accidents. 

Crawfordâ€™s run for Congress was emblematic of his lifetime of interest in government and politics. Ever since returning from law college in Washington, D.C., Dennis has been politically active in Nebraska politics. He served as Second Associate Chair of the Nebraska Democratic Party between 2012 and 2016.  

Dennis is married to Diane, and they have three adult children and one grandson.  He enjoys spending his free time following the Nebraska Cornhusker football team. 

Dr. Laura J. Crawford is the Assistant State Archaeologist at the Nebraska Historical Society in Lincoln. Dr. Crawford earned her undergraduate degree in anthropology at Creighton University, her Masterâ€™s degree in archaeology from the University of Alaska, and her doctorate in archaeology from The Ohio State University in 2020. In addition to working as an archaeologist in Nebraska, Dr. Crawford has performed extensive fieldwork in Alaska. She has also worked as an archaeologist in New Mexico, Iowa, Ohio, Hawaii, and Guam. When she is not doing archaeology or writing, Dr. Crawford enjoys spending time with her husband Ben and son Harlan. They like to visit the museums in town just like she did when she was growing up in Lincoln!

title: ACTIVIST CLOWN TOOLKIT: Become An Activist Clown and Mock Authoritarinism
description:
HAVE FUN AND BE MORE EFFECTIVE IN YOUR PROTESTS
--De-escalate tension and create more Instagrammable moments when you learn to utilize clowning as a playful means to address the injustices of authoritarianism. Clowns have always been societyâ€™s tricksters - exposing truths, mocking power, and bringing disruption & play to the frontlines of protests.

THE UNIQUE SPACE A CLOWN OCCUPIES derives its power from being on the fringes, from being not-quite-like-the-others, being a commentator, a rebel, a soothsayer. 

--STREET THEATRE is the key ingredient in STRATEGIC NONVIOLENT ACTION.  Explore clown as trickster, shaman, spectacle: who heals and critiques by disrupting the status quo.

DISCOVER YOUR ACTIVIST CLOWN
Tap into your inner activist clown with Indivisible activist Sheridan Hill and her UK colleague Robyn Hambrook www.robynhambrook.com A UK-based director, teacher and performer, Robyn is a passionate practitioner of clowning, physical theatre, circus and street arts, and founder of the Bristol Clown School.

-AN ANTIDOTE TO THESE OVERWHELMING TIMES, this four-part series will prepare you to speak truth to power at your next event, make a more significant impact than ever before, and have so much fun at the same time. 

-A TRICKSTERâ€™S GUIDE TO PLAYFUL REBELLION will explore the rebellious history and tactics of activist clowning, from ancient fools to modern disruptors. Through history, case studies, and hands-on exercises, weâ€™ll play with the tools of satire, spectacle, and collective mischief to challenge the status quoâ€”one red nose at a time.

--FIRST FOUR TUESDAYS IN JULY AT NOON EDT, this 4-part workshop series explores the dynamics of clowning; from the deeply regenerative practice of play, presence and pleasure to the liberation in being ridiculous, transgressive and rebellious.

ZOOM REMINDERS: Please leave your audio OFF and use the chat to talk to each other; Robyn needs our hour to teach. These classes will be part lecture and part practicum, with your video on so we can see each other.

MORE ABOUT ROBYN HAMBROOK

Over the past six years, Robyn Hambrook has been researching the intersection of clowning and protest driven by a deep desire to address the injustices in the world. This research has taken place in the streets, in protests, in research labs, online, with international collaborators and her Masters Research; â€˜Small Circus Acts of Resistanceâ€™.

Robynâ€™s recent collaborations and teaching projects include the Nomadic Rebel Clown Academy (5-day Activist Clown Training), The Laboratory of the Un-beautiful (Feminist Grotesque Bouffon Training for Womxn Theatre Makers) and the Clown Congress (annual gathering of clowns, activists and academics collectively exploring what it means to be a clown in this current era). Robyn has most recently founded the Bristol Clown School, creating a home for clowning in the South West of England.
www.robynhambrook.com / www.bristolclownschool.co.uk

title: Florida Senior Caucus
description:
DescriptionOn behalf of the Florida Democratic Senior Caucus and the Florida Democratic Organizing Council, thank you for registering for this very special meeting. This month, we are excited to welcome two speakers. They are Rick Wilson and Laura F. Kelley.

Co-founder and Board Member of The Lincoln Project, Rick Wilson is a renowned political strategist, infamous award-winning ad-maker and political podcast host, writer, speaker, and political commentator on MSNBC, CNN, ABC News, NPR, Real Time with Bill Maher, and various American and international news national outlets. A 30-year veteran of national Republican politics, Rick got his start in the 1988 Presidential campaign of George Herbert Walker Bush and has produced groundbreaking and award-winning political advertising, strategic counsel to winning political candidates, SuperPACS, state parties, the national campaign committees, and corporate, association, and government clients across the nation and around the world. 

Laura F. Kelley is the Chair of the Miami-Dade County Democratic Executive Committee and a passionate advocate for democracy, justice, and immigrant rights. She is the founder of LFK Immigration PA, a comprehensive boutique immigration law firm based in Doral, Florida, and has more than a decade of experience practicing immigration law. Laura previously served as Chair of the American Immigration Lawyers Association (AILA) South Florida Chapter and as Vice-Chair of AILA Nationalâ€™s Wellness Committee. In 2024, Laura ran for the Florida State House of Representatives in District 111, championing policies focused on expanding opportunity and protecting fundamental rights. She earned her JD from the University of California College of the Law San Francisco (formerly UC Hastings) in 2006 and her LLM in European Union Law from Universidad Carlos III in Madrid, Spain in 2009.

just for Collier County following  the presentation there will be a discussion with Laurie Plotnick, President Florida Senior Caucus on forming a Senior caucus in Collier County

title: Pack The Room: Protect Planned Parenthood from MAGA
description:
The Trump administration, its allies in Congress, and Elon Musk will do anything to shut down Planned Parenthood health centers, no matter how many patients lose health care. These politicians don't care about patients; they only want to give tax cuts to billionaires and big corporations.

The majority of Planned Parenthood health center patients â€” especially women, people of color, LGBTQ+ people, immigrants, and people with low incomes â€” rely on publicly funded programs, like Medicaid and Title X, to get quality reproductive health care. Attacks on Medicaid and Title X threaten millions of people's access to birth control, cancer screenings, STI testing and treatment, and more. 
 
Starting Tuesday, 5/13, members of Congress will attend hearings about proposed legislation that could  â€œdefundâ€ Planned Parenthood and gut Medicaid by billions of dollars. Join Planned Parenthood Action Fund on May 13 and 14 to attend these hearingsâ€“ we need your help to pack the rooms and show our support for essential health care! title: WORKSHOP | Yes, you can host a house party!
description:
**Why host a house party?**  Yes, door knocks, phone banks, postcards, rallies are all important organizing tools.  But in 2025-26, we need to do something more and different to win.  House parties can:

- Reach voters outside of our political bubbles

- Have friend and neighbor conversations with those who support our democratic values

- Inoculate voters against the onslaught of right-wing media

- Expand our volunteer base

**Are you thinking about hosting a house party, but don't know how to get started?**  If you've never hosted one before (and even if you're a fellow introvert), or just want a refresher, join the Bay Area Coalition every Monday, 7 pm (PT) for our ** *California-wide* ** house party workshop ...

 - How to plan your house party

 - Tips and tools for hosting conversations with your friends, neighbors, colleagues

 - Learn PDI-on-the-GO to find your local Democrats, or others who share our values

*You'll leave the workshop fired up and ready to host your house party!*

For more Bay Area Coalition actions: https://bayareacoalition.org/

title: Southern Idaho Town Hall Phone Bank (5/22)
description:
Please join us for a virtual phone bank ahead of our Southern Idaho town halls! On May 22nd, weâ€™ll be meeting at 5:30pm MT via Zoom to make phone calls to community members to invite them to upcoming town halls.

During the 2025 legislative session, Idaho lawmakers passed House Bill 93 and enacted a $50 million school-voucher program. For the first time in state history, Idaho tax dollars will be used to subsidize the cost of tuition for private-school families.

The special-interest groups promoting vouchers have made clear that the $50 million program is only the beginning. During next yearâ€™s legislative session, they intend to remove the $50-million cap and expand the program to all private-school families, including the wealthy, at an estimated cost of $339 million per year.

Such a massive expansion of vouchers would bankrupt Idaho and drain millions from public schools. For the benefit of a small number of private-school families, it would defund the public education system that serves 94% of Idahoâ€™s kids.

It may be inevitable that the legislature tries to expand House Bill 93, but it is not inevitable that they will succeed. To stop this attack on public schools, we need to get organized. Please sign up if you can make it and we hope to see you soon!

title: This is Your City Rally
description:
Weâ€™re less than three months away from the August primary. Iâ€™ve run a lot of campaigns over the years, and I know how important it is to set ambitious but achievable goals. So Iâ€™m calling it now. Hereâ€™s what weâ€™re going to do, together:

Weâ€™re going to be in first place on August 5th.

Thatâ€™s right, you heard it. Weâ€™re not just going to make it through the primary. Weâ€™re going to win more votes than Bruce Harrell.

We can absolutely do this. But itâ€™s not going to happen automatically, and itâ€™s not going to be easy. That said, there is one easy thing you can do right now to help us achieve this goal:

RSVP for the This Is Your City Rally coming up on Saturday, May 31st. [link]

This rally will kick off an intense, all-hands-on-deck, ten-week stretch of bringing our message to voters â€” especially infrequent and new voters â€” across Seattle. Because THAT is how weâ€™re going to win first place in the primary: by talking face-to-face with tens of thousands of people who arenâ€™t going to vote this year unless we reach them.

Needless to say, Iâ€™m going to need your help, whether thatâ€™s knocking on doors, phonebanking, talking to people at festivals and light rail stations, writing letters to fellow tenants in your apartment building, or texting your friends and family. You can do a lot of that right now, of course â€” but weâ€™re all going to have to turn it up a notch in the final stretch.

But beyond all that, here are three reasons why Iâ€™m really hoping to see you on May 31st:

To show our strength. Our rally will send a clear message to all the people who still think Harrell has this race locked down. At our March kickoff, 150 people came together to launch this campaign. Letâ€™s demonstrate how much our numbers have grown!

To build for the long haul. I know we can win this race, but itâ€™s about much more than getting one person elected. When Iâ€™m in City Hall, itâ€™s not like the entrenched interests that are fighting us on the campaign trail are going to give up and say â€œHow can we help?â€ Theyâ€™re going to keep fighting us. Theyâ€™re going to try to make sure Iâ€™m not able to do any of the good things we want to see happen for Seattle, and theyâ€™re going to try to turn the public against us. Weâ€™re going to need a powerful movement of people on the outside, organizing and building power, so we can make progress. Building that movement starts now.

Oh yeah, and itâ€™s going to be fun! Great company, good food, rousing speeches (but not too many), and meaningful action. Iâ€™m not saying there will be cornhole, but Iâ€™m also not saying there wonâ€™t be. What better way to spend a couple hours on your Saturday? 

Location and time are TBD, but it will be transit accessible. It will help us plan if you RSVP now!

location.venue: St. Louis County Libraryâ€“Meramec Valley Branch

description:

title: WORKSHOP | Yes, you can host a house party!
description:
**Why host a house party?**  Yes, door knocks, phone banks, postcards, rallies are all important organizing tools.  But in 2025-26, we need to do something more and different to win.  House parties can:

- Reach voters outside of our political bubbles

- Have friend and neighbor conversations with those who support our democratic values

- Inoculate voters against the onslaught of right-wing media

- Expand our volunteer base

**Are you thinking about hosting a house party, but don't know how to get started?**  If you've never hosted one before (and even if you're a fellow introvert), or just want a refresher, join the Bay Area Coalition every Monday, 5 pm (PT) / 7 pm (CT) / 8 pm (ET) for our ** *nationwide* ** house party workshop ...

 - How to plan your house party

 - Tips and tools for hosting conversations with your friends, neighbors, colleagues

*You'll leave the workshop fired up and ready to host your house party!*

For more Bay Area Coalition actions: https://bayareacoalition.org/

title: Canvass at a rally in Tarrytown (NY17) about the Tax Scam/Medicaid Cut Budget
description:
Leaflet and talk with constituents of [R] Rep. Lawler in Tarrytown, in the purple district of NY17 about the very unpopular budget/reconciliation bill that would cut trillions from Medicaid, and much more so that billionaires could get trillions in tax cuts. If Rep. Lawler gets lots of calls telling him to vote against this budget bill, it is possible to defeat it. The Republicans majority in the House is so small that the loss of Lawler's vote could kill it. We'll be meeting at Grand Central Station [information kiosk] at 9:30am to take a Metro North train to Tarrytown [arriving at 10:39am]. We'll have leaflets and wear signs "No Cuts to Medicaid" and "Billionaires Do Not Need Tax Cuts". We'll be approaching people in high traffic areas with leaflets and talk to them about this Tax Scam budget, urge them to phone Rep. Lawler and tell them about local actions planned by local groups that we work with. 


Swing Left is a grassroots organization that helps people make an impact in the elections that determine the national balance of power in the country. Our goal is simple: elect Democrats to help strengthen our democracy.
